#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation
How to generate KML files in Ektoo client and SyncServer

= Introduction =
The followind step by step procedure depict how we can generate kml files with mesh4x.

==1. Suppose a MsAccess file with the following data: ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_18.png

==2. Open Ektoo client and complete source and target data sources ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_1.png

==3. Open map window ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_2.png

==4. Complete title and description fields ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_3.png

Choose a property name from the combo box

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_4.png

Click add button to add this property name to the field

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_5.png

Automatically variable name '{MyTable/Name}' was added, mesh4x use this variable to replace the value when generate the kml file

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_6.png

==5. Complete Map lat/lon ==

For no map your data choose the following option:

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_7.png

If data has an address property choose the option 'the data has an address field', mesh4x translate it to a lat/lon coordinates. When the property is setted Button 'View KML' is enabled.

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_8.png

If data has a lat/lon coordinates choose the following option:

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_9.png

==6. Click 'View KML' button to generate kml file and open Google Earth ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_10.png

==7. Go to Ektoo client and press open Map window in Target section==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_11.png

==8. How the Meshgroup/Dataset does not exist in SyncServer all fields are filled with the values setted previously in source section==
Click 'save' button to accepts the map configuration.
Button 'view kml' is disabled because teh data is new in the cloud 

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_12.png

==9. Click 'Synchronize' button to create meshGroup/dataset in syncServer and synchronize data to the cloud, this action store rdf schema and mappings in the cloud==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_13.png

==10. Open Map window in the Target section, all fields are filled with the Map configuration saved in the cloud==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_16.png

==11. Click 'view kml' button to open Google Earth with the kml gnerated by the cloud==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_17.png

==12. Check the data in the cloud, Map configuration title and description is used to complete feed title and description==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_14.png

==13. Check the map configuration in the cloud ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_15.png

==14. We can open a kml generated by the cloud in a internet browser ==

http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/files/mesh4x_kml_ektoo_19.png
